pr_title: Use Mandrel floating tag and warn about its use

timeline.message: Use Mandrel floating tag and warn about its use
Use Mandrel floating tag and warn about its use

timeline.bodyText:
I'm not sure I agree with:
Consider using specific tags when going into production. We are only going to update the floating tag, 20.1-java11. For production it is not recommended to use a more specific tag, like 20.1.0.1.Final-java11. Do I interpret this incorrectly?
timeline.author: jerboaa
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -395,6 +395,9 @@ Building with Mandrel requires a custom builder image parameter to be passed add
 ./mvnw package -Pnative -Dquarkus.native.container-build=true -Dquarkus.native.builder-image=quay.io/quarkus/ubi-quarkus-mandrel:{mandrel-flavor}
 ----
 
+Please note that the above command points to a floating tag for ease of use,
+and to make sure you get the newest Mandrel version supported by Quarkus.
+Consider using specific tags when going into production.

replies.bodyText: The more specific tag won't receive an update (e.g. for the base image). The 20.1-java11 tag would, though.
replies.author: jerboaa

replies.bodyText: @galderz @jerboaa can you guys discuss this and decide if it needs adjustments or not? I need to merge it for backporting.
